relevant_findings.general: Well appearing man appearing younger than his stated age
relevant_findings.HEENT: Normocephalic, anicteric, oral cavity benign but dry mucous membranes, mild left facial droop (baseline reported by daughters)
relevant_findings.neck: No masses or lymphadenopathy, no thyroid nodules appreciated
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Irregular rate and rhythm, systolic murmur heard best at base radiating to carotids; no jugular venous distension; DP and radial pulses 2+ bilaterally
relevant_findings.pulmonary: Expansion equal bilaterally, soft rales at bases bilaterally
relevant_findings.abdominal: Soft, diffusely tender to palpation and slightly distended, no guarding or rebound
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm and well perfused, no cyanosis/coolness/edema
relevant_findings.neurological: Alert and oriented, cranial nerves II-XII grossly intact, some increased tone bilaterally, no tremor noted, mildly masked facies

relevant_findings.lab: Slightly elevated WBC count at 11.1 and elevated lipase, guiac negative

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported mild abdominal pain and nausea; energy and appetite decreased prior to presentation.
